1000 0008 1911 LDEQ FACILITY ID NUMBER

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The OxyChem facility at Hahnville, Louisiana (also referred to as Taft, Louisiana) is a producer of industrial chemicals.  OxyChem is a wholly owned subsidiary of Occidental Petroleum Corporation.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Stationary Source (A? 68.155(a))

OxyChem has established a system for the safe operation of the processes at this facility that includes the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances.  One component of this system is a program to manage the risks of accidental releases at the OxyChem Taft facility.  This program conforms to the requirements of the Environmental Protection AgencyA?s (EPAA?s) regulation 40 CFR part 68, Accidental Release Prevention Requirement Risk Management Programs (the RMP rule), and requirements of OSHA 1910.119.  This document is intended to satisfy the RMP plan requirement of the RMP rule and to provide the public with a description of the risk management program at the OxyChem Taft facility. 

The Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled (A? 68.155(b))

The OxyChem Taft facility consists of several production units that are wholly owned by OxyChem.  OxyChem operates all units at the site.  The facility handles one substance that is regulated by the RMP rule.  This substance is Chlorine.

The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Specific Prevention Steps    (A? 68.155(d))

The OxyChem Taft facilityA?s prevention program has been prepared so that it conforms to both the OSHA Process Safety Management and the EPA Risk Management Plan regulations.  The program consists of the following elements:

Process Safety Information    Employee Participation    Contractors
Process Hazard Analysis            Key Procedures            Pre-Startup Safety Review
Incident Investigation            Mechanical Integrity    Compliance Audits
Operating Procedures            Management of Change    Training

Each of the items li

sted above are documented and maintained in manuals at the facility.  These manuals are routinely updated.

Five-year Accident History (A? 68.155(e))

The OxyChem Taft Plant has had two accidents which meet the criteria in 40 CFR 68.42(a).  The largest of these releases was a 68-pound release of chlorine that required two on-site contractors to receive medical treatment.  A release of 54-pounds of chlorine also occurred and for protective measures, a nearby industrial facility was asked to shelter-in-place. 

Emergency Response Program (A? 68.155(f))

The OxyChem Taft facility has established a written emergency response plan and maintains an emergency response team (A?ERTA?) trained in these emergency response procedures.  All plant personnel are trained in evacuation procedures and in-plant drills are conducted periodically.  The drills are used to test the response time of the Emergency Response Team, to test the plant employee accountability program, and to activate the plantA?s Emergency Command Center (A?ECCA?).  In addition, the OxyChem Taft facility has developed a Special Situations Plan (A?SSPA?) which is a program designed for responding to emergencies that may have impacts beyond the immediate plant and is a supplement to the Emergency Response Plan.  The Special Situation Plan links the local response to the OxyChem Corporation Emergency Response Center located in Dallas, Texas.

The facility is a member of the St. Charles Parish Local Emergency Planning Committee (A?LEPCA?), which includes industrial and public entities.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety (A? 68.155(g))

The OxyChem Taft facility constantly tries to improve the safety of the processes through annual reviews of our plant procedures, near misses and incident investigation programs, and a program soliciting safety and environmental suggestions from the plant employees.  Additionally, the plant has implemented a number of security enhancements following 9/11/2001 to better prevent and/or d

eter unwanted intruders from entering the facility.

Certification Statement 

To the best of the undersignedA?s knowledge, information, and belief formed after reasonable inquiry, the information submitted is true, accurate, and complete.


Original on Cover Letter            Vic Pisani
